trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Lebanon
There were no other sightings in Lebanon on or around August 27th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsSometime after midnight on the 27th of August, 2009 I went outside on the patio to have a cigarette. I am not sure of the exact time, but I estimate that it was around 12:30 to 1:00 am. I noticed 2 red lights in the sky southeast of North Rt 48. Their brightness and size caught my attention. At first I thought it was an airplane, but I wondered why the fiery red lights on an aircraft. They appeared to be throwing off sparks; but much too large to be fireworks, and sort of "hanging" in the same location. No movement except flickering. The lights then separated somewhat, a larger one on top and the smaller one on bottom, and I realized this was not an airplane. The lower light then fizzled out and disappeared. In a second the larger light went out. There was no trail, no "shooting star" characteristics. This was only around 1-2 minutes at the most. I have seen "shooting stars" but this was nothing like that. They fizzled out without moving in any direction, just separated. I waited to see if this would reappear. I thought it may have gone behind a cloud or something, but that was it. I was baffled as to what I had seen.
Summary: Red Lights in Sky Near Lebanon, Ohio
